input_text:
Job Title: Supply Chain Analyst

Location: Superior, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
SummaryExcellent career opportunity for a Procurement Analyst with 1-3 years of experience in the oil refinery setting. In this role, you will be working with an outstanding flagship organization to support major US operations. You will utilize your technical aptitude and knowledge of oil refining specific materials to act as key regional resource ensuring the integrity of our client’s master data. As part of a high-functioning team, you will integrate data provided by engineering, maintenance, reliability, operations, and materials management groups through interaction with regional units and with a focus on compiling and maintaining accurate, consistent, robust, and timely data. You will work in a state of the art facility with beautiful office amenities and a professional and friendly staff.Responsibilities Transact all aspects of Materials Management and Inventory Control functionality using SAP and other computerized management systemMaintaining accurate and complete material master dataSupport our client’s Inventory Control functionality.Communicate effectively with all levels of the business unit and regional personnel regarding material master data and BOMsSupport the Material Master Creation and Initial BOM Creation processes, including: Review and validate material master request; update Bill of Materials; and provide input in the development of controls, processes and procedures to ensure effective maintenance and integrity of material master dataGather data and review all recommended inventory stocking levels for material masters to ensure the optimal levels are maintainedCommunicate with buyers and warehouse personnel to ensure materials are ordered and inventoried properlyProvide recommended process changes to Master Data and BOM Creation processes. Ensure implemented changes are documented and that all affected parties understand the changes and any new requirementsSupport corporate and site-specific projects.Interpret engineering drawings and technical documents to determine the correct requirements for MM options.Preferred Skills and ExpertiseAssociate’s degree (Bachelor’s degree preferred) in Business, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or related fieldStrong knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI, and SharePoint, etc.; and SAP and MMRS moduleDemonstrated knowledge of Master Data and BOM creation practicesDemonstrated ability to work collaboratively within a team structure to achieve set objectives and deliverables and strong ability to multi-task and handle multiple priorities and short timelines simultaneouslyCustomer oriented focus, delivering for customers and communicating effectively.PandoLogic. Keywords: Management Analyst, Location: Superior, WI - 54880

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Supply Chain Analyst
output_json.summary: Procurement Analyst opportunity in oil refinery setting.
job_responsibilities: Transact Materials Management and Inventory Control using SAP
Communicate with business unit and regional personnel
Support Material Master and BOM creation processes
Gather and review inventory stocking levels
Communicate with buyers and warehouse personnel
Interpret engineering drawings and technical documents

other.content: Associate’s degree (Bachelor’s degree preferred) in Business, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or related field
Strong knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI, and SharePoint, etc.; and SAP and MMRS module

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within a team structure to achieve set objectives and deliverables and strong ability to multi-task and handle multiple priorities and short timelines simultaneously
